min.description: Desired lower bound for each column of the data. Used only if `categories` is `None`.

max.description: Desired upper bound for each column of the data. Used only if `categories` is `None`.

categories.description: The set of categories you want to be represented for each column of the data.

null_value.description: The value to which elements not included in `categories` will be mapped for each column of the data. Used only if `categories` is not `None`.

name: clamp
description:
Clamps data to the provided bounds.


                If data are numeric, clamping maps elements outside of an interval `[min, max]` to the closer endpoint.

                If data are categorical, clamping maps elements outside of the `categories` argument to the associated `null`.
